name: Trevor Allred
summary: I am a software executive with a passion for programming. I design, build, deploy, and manage SaaS applications for consumers and enterprise users alike. Ever since I built my first social network, Rockclimbing.com, in 1999, I have excelled at bringing value to end users via the web. With almost 30 years of programming experience--20 years professionally--I have a passion for building solutions. As a natural leader and with help from my two business degrees I am able to understand the business world very well. My natural intelligence coupled with a strong personality enable me to understand an immense range of technologies, engineers, processes, and scenarios. I always want to be on the winning team and work tirelessly to recruit the best people, create the most efficient environment, and deliver the best product possible.

where.name: PICS Auditing, LLC
where.summary: As VP of Engineering, I am in charge of our flagship product PICS Organizer--a web based application that enables large companies manage their subcontractors.
where.about: Founded in 2003, PICS has grown After 5 years of organic growth, we took our first round of funding from NVP [http://www.nvp.com/].
where.role: In 2007 I was employee #7 at PICS. I started as the Development Manager with one part time contractor.

whats.name: PICS Intranet
whats.summary: Implemented and championed an Intranet for PICS to internally share knowledge, processes, documentation, and other useful information.

whats.name: GUARD Builder
whats.summary: Created a set of tools for use by business analysts to build a robust and scalable question/answer workflow for clients in a wide variety of industries.
whats.about: PICS needed to gather tens of thousands of questions from clients each day. Using a multi-tenant architecture, we needed a robust, yet flexible architecture. GUARD Builder technology enables business analysts to create a wide range of questionnaires based on the client's location, industries, and risk profiles.

where.name: RemedyMD
where.about: Remedy Informatics was founded in 2003 by Matt MacKay and Gary Kennedy.
where.role: Shortly after starting, RemedyMD was looking to expand their management team.

where.name: UCI Merage School of Business
where.about: The Paul Merage School of Business at UC Irvine provides MBA programs to technology minded leaders. While the Merage School is relatively young, it has quickly grown to consistently rank among the top 10% of programs through exceptional student recruitment, world-class faculty, a strong alumni network and close relationships with both individual business executives and global corporations.

where.name: Rand Technology
where.about: Founded in 1992, Rand had about 100 employees and specialized in trading high quality electronic components.
where.role: As the only software developer, I built and managed Rand's asset tracking and invoicing system.

where.name: Rockclimbing.com
where.about: Rockclimbing.com was one of the first social sports websites, which included a variety of spaces including articles, photos, routes, forums, and shopping.

whats.name: Unum Claims Processor
whats.about: Implementation and data conversion for a large claims management system for Unum in Tennessee.

whats.name: ERP for iLink
whats.about: Client/Server application for rapidly growing long distance provider iLink.

whats.name: B.S. Management Information Systems
whats.summary: A Bachelors of Science degree with a perfect blend of business and computer science. We studied topics CS topics like database design, SDLC, Visual Basic

what.name: Resume IO
what.summary: This is an open source project that I created to better display my background and to experiment with AngularJS.
